chunks.content: Submit credits to credits@driscollfoods.com (Wayne & PA DSMs). Credits must be submitted by the district manager to inside sales. Include: completed credit form, pictures of product, pick labels, manufacturer codes, identifying materials, signed invoice (from archive), and operational error email if applicable.

chunks.content: Perishable pickup policy: We will NOT pick up perishable items ordered in error - these must be refused at time of delivery. Exception: perishable meat items with quality issues will be picked up for inspection so customer doesn't have to hold them.

chunks.quality_reasoning: Core pickup policy for perishables, bounded to error orders with clear meat exception; simple, self-contained, and directly guides actions

jargon.perishable items: Items subject to spoilage or decay such as food products requiring special handling
jargon.perishable meat items: Specific perishable goods (meat) eligible for pickup exception due to quality defects
jargon.pickup: Retrieval of goods from customer location for return or inspection

chunks.content: Request PCM (Product Category Margin) setup via pcmrequest@driscollfoods.com. PCM assigns pricing headers by category - drill into subcategories and assign margins over sales cost. PCM is mandatory for customers using Cut & Dry (online ordering system).

chunks.content: Submit New Customer Alert (NCA) to ncarequests@driscollfoods.com for opening orders. Critical: get delivery days and time window precisely correct.

chunks.content: Submit Critical Attention Request (CAR) to carrequests@driscollfoods.com for one-time special handling. Unlike NCA, CAR is a single-instance request for case-by-case special care. Include: customer number, name, order number, delivery day, time window, and applicable notes.

jargon.NCA: a contrasting request type to CAR (not specified as single-instance)

chunks.content: NCA vs CAR: NCA (New Customer Alert) flags account for 60 days of special care for new customers. CAR (Critical Attention Request) is a one-time request for special handling on a specific order/situation. Use NCA for new accounts, CAR for existing accounts needing one-time attention.

NCA_duration.context: flags account for special care for new customers

jargon.Credits: Requests for account credits, such as for returns, shortages, or billing adjustments

jargon.Forced Pickups: Urgent or mandatory pickup requests that bypass standard scheduling
